intro: Oxyspora robusta, commonly known as the robust oxyspora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Oxyspora robusta is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
